issue.title: [C++] Opening a writeable file on disk that already exists does not truncate to zero
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-340](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-340). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This can result in corrupted files. On creating a "new" file, it needs to be truncated to zero bytes.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-340?focusedCommentId=15793453) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
This has been fixed, but needs a unit test.
